title: TechSinger: Technique Controllable Multilingual Singing Voice Synthesis via Flow Matching
author: Wenxiang Guo (Zhejiang University), Yu Zhang (Zhejiang University), Changhao Pan (Zhejiang University), Rongjie Huang (Zhejiang University), Li Tang (Zhejiang University), Ruiqi Li (Zhejiang University), Zhiqing Hong (Zhejiang University), Yongqi Wang (Zhejiang University), Zhou Zhao (Zhejiang University)
relevance_why: The techniques described for singing voice synthesis, particularly the controllability of vocal attributes, align closely with Haohe Liu's interest in audio and music processing. This could enhance the development of creative audio applications and generative models.
background: This paper focuses on generating singing voices that can emulate diverse techniques (like breathy or vibrato) and support multiple languages, using advanced machine learning methods.
contribution: TechSinger introduces a novel flow-matching-based generative model for fine-grained control over singing techniques, achieving high-quality and realistic vocal outputs across five languages.
technical_comparison: Previous methods lacked precise control over vocal techniques in a multilingual context, while this work incorporates a technique detection model and a prompt-based approach for user-defined vocal attributes, enabling more sophisticated audio synthesis.
key_innovation: The integration of natural language prompts to specify vocal techniques makes the system user-friendly and versatile in generating synthetic singing voices.
real_world_impact: Could revolutionize areas such as music production and personalized audio applications, providing creators with enhanced tools for expressive music generation.
limitations: No limitations explicitly mentioned by the authors.

new_terms.flow matching: **Flow matching** is a generative modeling technique that optimizes the mapping between noise and data distributions to facilitate more efficient data generation.
new_terms.classifier-free guidance: **Classifier-free guidance** is a method that adjusts the generation process based on uncertain context, using unconditional and conditional model outputs to improve performance.

open_sourcing: Code and demo available at https://github.com/gwx314/TechSinger and https://tech-singer.github.io respectively.
